document.docTitle: Curculio subfenestratus Pelsue & Zhang, 2002, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A Review Of The Genus Curculio From China With Descriptions Of New Taxa. Part III. The Curculio subfenestratus Voss Group (Curculionidae: Curculioninae: Curculionini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Review Of The Genus Curculio From China With Descriptions Of New Taxa. Part III. The Curculio subfenestratus Voss Group (Curculionidae: Curculioninae: Curculionini)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Species of
Curculio subfenestratus
Group

paragraph.keyLead:
1 All femora unarmed. Male 2.75 mm ( Figs. 1–2 ) ---
C. misellus (Heller)

2(1′) Profemur with ventral beard as long as femoral tooth, 6–7.3 mm ( Figs.7–8 ) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
C. conjugalis (Faust)
2′ Profemur without ventral beard as long as femoral tooth ---------------------- 3
3′ Antennal club shorter than funicular segments 4–7 combined ----------- 19

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 1–2.
Curculio miscellus (Heller)
. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Figs. 3–4.
Curculio funebris (Roelofs)
. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Figs. 5–6.
Curculio notobifasciatus Pajni and Singh.
Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Various scales.

paragraph.keyLead:
5(4) Antennal club longer than funicular segments 4–7. Male 3.5 mm (Figs. 5–6) -----------------------------------------------------------
C. notobifasciatus Pajni and Singh

5′ Antennal club longer than funicular segments 2–7. Male 3.0– 4.8 mm (Figs. 3–4) --------------------------------------------------------------------------
C. funebris (Roelofs)
6′ Tooth on hind femur medium to large (Fig. 18) -------------------------------------- 12

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 7–8.
Curculio conjugalis (Faust)
. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Figs. 9–10.
Curculio interpositus Voss.
Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Figs. 11–12.
Curculio convexus (Roelofs)
. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Various scales.

paragraph.keyLead:
9(8′) Sternite 1 as long as 2 behind coxal cavity; elytra convex in lateral view. Male 3.3–3.7 mm (Figs. 11–12) ------------------
C. convexus (Roelofs)

9′ Sternite 1 longer than 2 behind coxal cavity; elytra flat lateral view. Male 3.3 mm (Figs. 63–64) -----------------------
C. albisquama Ter­Minassian

11(10′) Abdominal sternite 1 longer than 2 behind coxal cavities; metauncus medium shorter than tarsal claw. Male 3.4 mm (Figs. 15–16) --------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C. luteusvittus
n. sp.

11′ Abdominal sternite 1 as long as 2 behind coxal cavity, metauncus small. Male 2.7 mm (Figs. 17–18) ------------------------
C. gansuensis
n. sp.

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 13–14.
Curculio helleri
n. sp. Female, habitus dorsal and lateral views, holotype. Figs. 15–16.
Curculio luteusvittus
n. sp. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views, holotype. Figs. 17–18.
Curculio gansuensis
n. sp. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views, holotype. Various scales.

paragraph.keyLead:
14(13′) Abdominal sternite 2 longer than 1 behind coxal cavity. Male 3.4 mm (Figs. 21–22) -------------------------------------------------
C. flavoscutellatus (Roelofs)

14′ Abdominal sternite 1 longer than 2 behind coxal cavity. Male 4.1 mm (Figs. 23–24) ------------------------------------------------------------------
C. klapperichi Voss

15(12′) Metauncus bifid; scape not as long as funicular segments 1–4; rostrum broad to insertion of scape then abruptly narrows to apex. Male 4.8– 5.6 mm ( Figs. 25–26 ) ------------------------------------------
C. breviscapus (Heller)
15′ Metauncus simple; scape as long or longer than funicular segments 1–4; rostrum gradually narrowing to apex -------------------------------------------- 16

keyLead.keyStep: 16(15′) Male scape as long as funicular segments 1–6 ------------------------------------ 17

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 19–20.
Curculio challeti
n. sp. Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views, holotype. Figs. 21–22.
Curculio flavoscutellatus (Roelofs)
Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Figs. 23–24.
Curculio klapperichi Voss
Male, habitus dorsal and lateral views. Various scales.

keyLead.keyStep: 16′ Male scape shorter than funicular segments 1–6 -------------------------------- 18

paragraph.keyLead:
17′ Hind femoral tooth of male large, wedge shaped; mesosternal intercoxal process not prominent. Male 5.5–6.0 mm (Figs. 29–30) -------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C. maculanigra (Roelofs)

18(16′) Rostrum gradually emerging from head, less than half as long as body. Male 4.2 mm ( Figs. 31–32 ) ---------------------------------
C. carlae
n. sp.

18′ Rostrum abruptly emerging from head, longer than half body length. Female 3.6–4.2 mm (Figs. 65–66) ------------------------------
C. balmeri
n. sp.
